thread.section_title: Isolated Thunderstorms Moving In; Possible Funnel Cloud Spotted In Near Lincoln – CBS Sacramento
thread.title: Isolated Thunderstorms Moving In; Possible Funnel Cloud Spotted In Near Lincoln
thread.title_full: Isolated Thunderstorms Moving In; Possible Funnel Cloud Spotted In Near Lincoln

author: Cecilio Padilla
title: Isolated Thunderstorms Moving In; Possible Funnel Cloud Spotted In Near Lincoln
text:
LINCOLN (CBS13) – The National Weather Service is investigating reports of a funnel cloud in Placer County.
CBS13 viewers reported seeing the funnel cloud west of Lincoln.
A CBS13 viewer says they saw a possible funnel cloud near Lincoln. Taken by Elpidio Plasencia on the Twelve Bridges ramp onto Highway 65 looking west.
NWS forecasters say isolated thunderstorms are developing north of Sacramento. Heavy rain, occasional lightning and funnel clouds are possible.
Isolated thunderstorms developing this afternoon north of Sacramento. Expect brief heavy rain and occasional lightning, funnel clouds. #CAwx pic.twitter.com/0LCwwEirxb 
— NWS Sacramento (@NWSSacramento) January 9, 2017
